About
Hi! I am a master’s student in the Department of Economics at Istanbul Technical University, Turkey.


Research Interests

Causal Inference & Econometrics
Labor Economics
Economics of Migration
Development Economics



Computer Skills

Fluent: R, Stata, Quarto & R Markdown, \(\LaTeX\) & TikZ, git, Microsoft Office
Familiar: Python, HTML, Bash, Adobe Products



Contact:
akyolz19 [at] itu [dot] edu [dot] tr

title: Research Experience
text:
Research Assistant at Department of Economics  (03/2021 - Present)  Istanbul Technical University
Research Assistant to Assoc. Prof. Aysegul Kayaoglu  (07/2020 - Present)  Istanbul Technical University
Researcher to Assoc. Prof. Aysegul Kayaoglu  (10/2021 - 07/2022)  UNICEF Turkey, Consultancy on Child Labor Legislation and Policy Improvement
Field Research Assistant  (11/2020 - 01/2021)   A. Kayaoglu (2021), A Youth Centered Participatory Assessment in Turkey: Understanding Refugee and Host Community Youth’s Perceptions, Challenges and Needs. London, Save the Children International.
Data Coding Team  (02/2020 - 03/2020)   A. Kayaoglu (2021), A Gender-sensitive Study on Urban Child Labor in Istanbul. London, Save the Children International.

title: Understanding Missing Values in Regression
text:
This blog post is about understanding missing value mechanism in a regression setting. After understanding this machanism, I will mention common pitfalls to aviod in data subsetting.

title: Understanding Missing Values in Regression
text:
5.1 Appendix
I can fill this with regular Markdown. This is bold. This is italic.
Also, code chunks work.

library(ggplot2)
mpg |>
  ggplot(aes(hwy, cty)) +
  geom_jitter()








(Remove # and . in {.r}. It’s only here for the demo. Without it, this is a nested code block. And this does not render well.)

title: Reading Groups
text:
I organize two long-term online reading groups.
The code of our logos are available at github.com/zekiakyol/logos.











Machine Learning Readings


 An Introduction to Statistical Learning - Gareth James, Trevor Hastie, Daniela Witten,  Rob Tibshirani, Jonathan Taylor (2nd Edition 2021)  10 members.


(Summer 2023) 




Proof-Based Math Readings
Proof-Based Math Readings is a free and independent online reading group where we study mathematics required in economics master’s/PhD programs using an intuitive approach.
Our syllabuses and application form are available at github.com/zekiakyol/proof-based-math-readings


 Measure, Integration & Real Analysis - Sheldon Axler (1st Edition 2020)    Linear Algebra Done Right - Sheldon Axler (4th Edition 2023)    General Topology - Seymour Lipschutz (2011)    Matrix Algebra - Karim M. Abadir, Jan R. Magnus (2005)    Introduction to Real Analysis, Volume I - Jiri Lebl (6.0 Edition 2023)  22 Members.   Book of Proof - Richard Hammack (3.3 Edition 2022)  14 members. 


(Summer 2024)   (Spring 2024)   (Winter 2023)   (Fall 2023)   (Fall 2023)   (Summer 2023)

title: Photos
text:
The Purest of Doggos

"I'm so happy today!"

"I see those nugs."

"I love you so much!"

"I'm the baby of the house!"

"Are you gunna throw the ball?"

"C'mon friend!"

"A rose for mommy!"

"You gunna finish that?"

"We can't afford a cat!"

"Dis my fren!"
